revised_title: Attempt to Apply Instrumental Measurement to the Zodiacal Light
scientific_discipline: Astronomy > Zodiacal Light Observation and Measurement
tldr: The author, Marquis of Northampton, describes an equatorial instrument designed to measure the right ascension and declination of the apex of the zodiacal light. He shares his observations made between 1844-45, which show that the phenomenon is more stable and determinate than previously thought. The author encourages other observers to continue studying the zodiacal light to resolve its remaining ambiguities.
